name: LAN Toggle

screenshots.caption: "LAN Disabled" Systray Icon with Windows Nettwork and Sharing Icon

short_description: Toggle Windows "Local Area Connection" status between "Enabled" and "Disabled" from a systray icon with one click. Icon displays connection status by green or red color. Made for my own use, but I will add Wifi or other interface functionality, run on boot/autostart, and right-click menus, including "Exit," to auto-detect and toggle multiple network interfaces (perhaps with info display/function) if there is enough interest or as I need or care to, so check back. As it stands, the executable must be started manually, or a start-on-boot entry created manually and killed from the task manager ("lanupdown.exe").
summary: One-click toggle LAN Status from Windows System Tray
